poem:
Title: Upon Waking to an Unfamiliar Battle Cry

Morning scratches across the silent page,
Inscribe the tongues of different tongues,
Israel, Gaza, in the same stage,
An inevitable play, unsung.

Bellow of war, above the dove's humble tune,
Fear clings, like rust on the weathered heart,
A summit's lament echoes under the rosy moon,
Yet in the orchestra of life, we each play a part.
